related_post.text: @Deleted User This is actually a pretty good SO for partials vs lambda. <https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3252228/pythonwhyisfunctoolspartialnecessary>The second answer with the code snippet is very useful to seeing the difference in how they execute. Try running this code:```pysum = lambda x y: x + yn = 5incr_lambda = lambda y: sum(n y)incr_partial = partial(sum n)print(f"Lambda: {incr_lambda(3)}")print(f"Partial: {incr_partial(3)}")n = 9print("n = 9")print(f"Lambda: {incr_lambda(3)}")print(f"Partial: {incr_partial(3)}")```

Try running this code:```pysum = lambda x y: x + yn = 5incr_lambda = lambda y: sum(n y)incr_partial = partial(sum n)print(f"Lambda: {incr_lambda(3)}")print(f"Partial: {incr_partial(3)}")n = 9print("n = 9")print(f"Lambda: {incr_lambda(3)}")print(f"Partial: {incr_partial(3)}")```
